content:
• Thursday, May 2, 2013
  • AIG

    More on AIG's Q1 earnings: Property & Casualty is back with operating income of $1.6B vs....

    More on AIG's Q1 earnings: Property & Casualty is back with operating income of $1.6B vs. $1B a year ago. The combined ratio falls to 97.2 from 102.1 a year ago - it was the 2012 Q3 report in November when the stock got hit for 5.5% after the company reported a combined ratio of 105 (higher is worse; over 100 means claims exceed premiums). Conference call Friday at 8 ET. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 PM
  • AGNC

    Swept up in the hit to American Capital Agency (AGNC -8.3% AH) is its sister firm American...

    Swept up in the hit to American Capital Agency (AGNC -8.3% AH) is its sister firm American Capital Mortgage (MTGE -5.4% AH). MTGE differs from AGNC in that it invests in non-agency MBS as well as agency paper, but both share Gary Kain as CIO. AGNC's conference call is set for Friday at 11 ET - how much did February's dilutive secondary hit the Q1 numbers?
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 PM | 29 Comments
  • ARR

    Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR): Q1 core EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.05. Book value of $6.69/share,...

    Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR): Q1 core EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.05. Book value of $6.69/share, down from $7.29 on Dec. 31 (was estimated at $6.70-$6.76 on Feb. 13). Net interest margin of 1.35% off 20 bps from Q4. CPR of 15.7% vs. 14.1% in Q4. Shares -1.55% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 PM | 7 Comments
  • DOLE

    More on Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q1 comes in just shy of EPS estimates as net earnings swung to a...

    More on Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q1 comes in just shy of EPS estimates as net earnings swung to a loss on charges related to the recent divestiture of several business lines and a 3% Y/Y decline revenue. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • KHC

    More on Kraft Foods (KRFT): Q1 handily beats as its standalone strategy begins to take hold. The...

    More on Kraft Foods (KRFT): Q1 handily beats as its standalone strategy begins to take hold. The saw cost savings materialize faster than expected in the quarter and pushed hard to defend itself from new entrants in some of its namesake categories, like macaroni and cheese. Sales rose 2.1%, improving significantly from a 7.2% decline in the previous quarter due to built- up inventory at retailers ahead of last October's split-up. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPEN

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) OpenTable (OPEN - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $44.9M-$46.2M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) OpenTable (OPEN - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $44.9M-$46.2M and EPS of $0.45-$0.49 vs. a consensus of $46.7M and $0.47. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $185.3M-$190.9M and EPS of $1.88-$2.02 vs. a consensus of $189.6M and $1.91. 2) ON Semi (ONNN - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $675M-$715M vs. a $702.6M consensus. 3) Active Network (ACTV - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $128M-$133M, below a $136.4M consensus. No 2013 guidance due to recent management upheaval. OPEN -3.1% AH. ONNN -2.4%. ACTV -0.7%. (OpenTable PR) (ON Semi PR) (Active Network PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • KOG

    More on Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q1 misses across the board as bottom line EPS comes in...

    More on Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q1 misses across the board as bottom line EPS comes in at half of what the Street was looking for. Overall sales volume increased by 103% Q/Q, with 1.95 MMBOE sold, or an average of 21,700 BOE per day, as compared to 963K BOE, or 10,578 BOE per day in Q112. Crude oil revenue accounted for approximately 94% of oil and gas sales recorded during the quarter. Net cash provided by operating activities was $114.6M, as compared to $69.1M in Q112, an increase of 66%. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 24 Comments
  • PKT

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PKT +23%. BCOR +12%. INVN +8%. FORM +7%. FLT +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PKT +23%. BCOR +12%. INVN +8%. FORM +7%. FLT +6%.
    After-hours top losers: ZAGG -26%. VCRA -26%. GUID -20%. ARNA -15%. BRKR -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM
  • ARNA

    More on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA): Q1 misses EPS estimates badly, but adding to an...

    More on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA): Q1 misses EPS estimates badly, but adding to an afternoon beating by investors is the company's disclosure that it's withdrawn a regulatory application to sell its weight-loss Belviq therapy in the European Union after calculating it wouldn't get a positive decision. Shares -15.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • WFT

    More on Weatherford's (NYSE:WFT) Q1 results: Took a $61M charge due to foreign exchange losses...

    More on Weatherford's (NYSE:WFT) Q1 results: Took a $61M charge due to foreign exchange losses from the devaluation of the Venezuelan bolivar. Operating margin narrowed to 7.3% from 10.3%. North America revenues were $1.69B, -4% Y/Y; international revenues were $2.14B, +17%. Expects H2 2013 to show modest growth in North America revenues and operating income. Shares -2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • HAIN

    More on Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): Q1 meets on EPS but comes up short on the revenue side....

    More on Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): Q1 meets on EPS but comes up short on the revenue side. Net sales grew to a record $456M, up 21% from the prior year period. For FY13, the company sees net sales in the range of $1.727B to $1.734B, and earnings of around $2.43 to $2.47 per share. The Street is looking for $1.7413B and an EPS of $2.46. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • ARMH

    ARM (ARMH +0.1%) largely missed out on today's rally after GPU core rival Imagination...

    ARM (ARMH +0.1%) largely missed out on today's rally after GPU core rival Imagination (OTCPK:IGNMF) fell 25.7% in London thanks to a warning. Imagination expects its FY13 (ended in April) licensing revenue to fall 22% Y/Y to £27M due to delayed deal closings, something it blames on "structural and organisational changes" at licensees. FY14 licensing revenue (exc. MIPS) is expected to total £30m- £35m, also below expectations. The damage to ARM was likely limited due to the fact ARM's share gains might be partly responsible for the warning - ARM's Mali GPU core shipments rose 5x Y/Y in Q1, and 3 new licenses were signed (raising the total to 75). (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford (NYSE:WFT): Q1 EPS of $0.15 in-line. Revenue of $3.84B (+6.9% Y/Y) misses by $60M....

    Weatherford (NYSE:WFT): Q1 EPS of $0.15 in-line. Revenue of $3.84B (+6.9% Y/Y) misses by $60M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • MYL

    More on Mylan (NASDAQ:MYL): Q1 misses on top line estimates as net earnings fell 17% Y/Y amid...

    More on Mylan (NASDAQ:MYL): Q1 misses on top line estimates as net earnings fell 17% Y/Y amid acquisition-related expenses and other items. The generic-drug maker reported modest growth for the quarter, thanks to its specialty business which posted revenue growth of 22% to $226.6M. Generics revenue was flat at $1.41B, as growth in its EMEA segment and its Asia Pacific business was offset by declines in North America. Gross margin rose slightly to 42.5% from 42.3%. Shares -3.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • PKT

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Procera (PKT - earnings) expects 2013 revenue growth of "at least...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Procera (PKT - earnings) expects 2013 revenue growth of "at least 30%," above prior guidance of 25%-30% and a consensus of 24.6%. But higher operating expenses will lead 2H operating results to be near breakeven (2H EPS consensus is $0.24). 2) Blucora (BCOR - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $113M-$117.5M and EPS of $0.51-$0.55, above a consensus of $108M and $0.29. 3) Echelon (ELON - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $22.5M-$25.5M and EPS of -$0.05 to -$0.11 vs. a consensus of $24.3M and -$0.11. PKT +18.7% AH. BCOR +12.1%. ELON unchanged. (Procera PR) (Blucora PR) (Echelon PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • GILD

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q1 misses on all counts, but investors appear to be...

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q1 misses on all counts, but investors appear to be focused more on the potential of its new HIV drug lines. Net earnings rose 63% Y/Y on increased sales for the newer additions to its HIV drug franchise, including Stribild, an HIV cocktail that was launched in late August. The drug contributed $92.1M to product sales in the latest quarter, while sales for Complera, which was approved last August, rose more than three-fold to $148.2M. Shares +0.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) has resumed trading after missing Q1 estimates and cutting guidance, and it's...

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) has resumed trading after missing Q1 estimates and cutting guidance, and it's not pretty. Shares -24% AH to a new 52-week low of $5.11. The mobile accessory maker now expects 2013 revenue of $274M-$280M, far below a prior range of $313M-$318M and a consensus of $315.8M. 2013 adjusted EBITDA is now expected to total $55M-$57M, down from a prior $69M-$71M. Q1 gross margin was 37%, down from Q1 2012's 49% thanks to a mix shift away from high-margin invisibleSHIELD screen protectors. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • FLR

    More on Fluor's (NYSE:FLR) Q1 results: New awards were $6.5B, including $3.1B in oil/gas...

    More on Fluor's (NYSE:FLR) Q1 results: New awards were $6.5B, including $3.1B in oil/gas and $2.2B in industrial/infrastructure. Consolidated backlog at the end of Q1 was $37.5B, down 12% Y/Y mainly due to a downturn in the mining and metals market. Reaffirms FY 2013 guidance, seeing EPS of $3.85-$4.35 vs. $4.18 analyst consensus. Shares +2.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM

    Fortune Brands Home & Security (NYSE:FBHS): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $890M...

    Fortune Brands Home & Security (NYSE:FBHS): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $890M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $27.46M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM

    Solar stocks spiked in the final hour of trading (TAN +2.3%) after SunPower's blowout Q1 results...

    Solar stocks spiked in the final hour of trading (TAN +2.3%) after SunPower's blowout Q1 results were leaked. LDK +8%. JKS +9.5%. JASO +11%. TSL +7.5%. WFR +3.6%. DQ +4.6%. YGE +3.7%. FSLR +1.4% after spending most of the day in negative territory.

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $45.5M misses by $0.08M....

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $45.5M misses by $0.08M. Shares -4.2% AH. (PR)

  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q1 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $165M (+106.6%...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q1 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $165M (+106.6% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)

  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC -1.1%) finishes the day in the red after posting a mixed Q1 report following...

    Exelon (EXC -1.1%) finishes the day in the red after posting a mixed Q1 report following yesterday's close. Net earnings swung to a loss as the utility posted significant mark-to-market charges, which offset a 30% Y/Y jump in revenue. Operating margin rose to 8.4% from 7.7%, though total operating expenses increased 29%. Wunderlich cut the shares to Hold on valuation following the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • AIG

    More from AIG's Q1 earnings: A slight miss on revenues ($8.56B vs. $8.64B expected) isn't...

    More from AIG's Q1 earnings: A slight miss on revenues ($8.56B vs. $8.64B expected) isn't damping AH enthusiasm with shares up 2.5%. Q1 after-tax operating income of $2B compares with prior-year $3B - which had included pretax income from investments (including Maiden Lane) disposed of in 2012. Insurance operating income of $3B is up 28% Y/Y. "Our priority this year is to improve operating fundamentals and reduce costs," says CEO Robert Benmosche.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 11 Comments
  • ACTV

    Active Network (NYSE:ACTV): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $106M (+12% Y/Y) beats...

    Active Network (NYSE:ACTV): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $106M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $1.1M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management (NYSE:HMA): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.02. Net Revenue of $1.48B. Shares...

    Health Management (NYSE:HMA): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.02. Net Revenue of $1.48B. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • TDC

    Teradata (NYSE:TDC): Q1 EPS of $0.43 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $587M (-4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Teradata (NYSE:TDC): Q1 EPS of $0.43 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $587M (-4% Y/Y) misses by $25.1M. Expects 2013 revenue growth to now be at low end of guidance range of 6%-10%; consensus is at 8.1%. Expects 2013 EPS to now be at low end of guidance range of $3.05-$3.20; consensus is at $3.08. Shares -10.5% AH (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG): Q1 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $51.7M (-7% Y/Y) misses by $15M....

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG): Q1 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $51.7M (-7% Y/Y) misses by $15M. The company cuts FY13 sales and profit guidance. Shares are halted in after-hours trading. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $324.7M (+72% Y/Y) beats by $7.6M....

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $324.7M (+72% Y/Y) beats by $7.6M. Expects Q2 revenue of $342M-$347M, below $359.2M consensus. Expects 2013 revenue of $1.43B-$1.46B, below $1.49B consensus. Shares -11.4% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • AIG

    AIG (NYSE:AIG): Q1 diluted EPS of $1.49; after-tax operating income per share of $1.34. Book...

    AIG (NYSE:AIG): Q1 diluted EPS of $1.49; after-tax operating income per share of $1.34. Book value per share excluding AOCI of $59.39 (up 12% Y/Y). Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPWR

    More on SunPower: $216M in free cash flow was generated in Q1, leading the company to end the...

    More on SunPower: $216M in free cash flow was generated in Q1, leading the company to end the quarter with $506M in cash. Revenue fell 1% Y/Y. Americas revenue (72% of total) +15% Y/Y, EMEA -56%, Asia-Pac +46%. Revenue was recognized on 173MW of module shipments, down from 225MW in Q4 and 196MW in Q1 2012. 208MW of cells were produced, up from Q4's 153MW and down from Q1 2012's 288MW. Capex was just $12M (-68% Y/Y). Americas had a healthy 32.5% gross margin, EMEA a not-so-healthy -32.2%, Asia-Pac 18.2%. Q2 guidance to be provided during May 15 analyst day. SPWR +17.6%. (data sheet) (slides) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +5.9%) is nearing the end of the regulatory review of its planned purchase of BP's...

    Tesoro (TSO +5.9%) is nearing the end of the regulatory review of its planned purchase of BP's 240K bbl/day Carson, Calif., refinery, CEO Greg Goff says in today's conference call. TSO says it plans to combine the plant with its 103K bbl/day Wilmington refinery; the purchase is expected to take place by the end of this quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWR +12.4%) soars in the final hour of trading as earnings slides leak ahead of this...

    SunPower (SPWR +12.4%) soars in the final hour of trading as earnings slides leak ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report. The slides indicate SunPower posted Q1 revenue of $574.6M and EPS of $0.22, trouncing a consensus of $507.7M and $0.06. Gross margin was 22.7%, up 400 bps Q/Q and 1000 bps Y/Y. (data sheet)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +6.2%) powers higher after reporting double-digit Q1 production...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +6.2%) powers higher after reporting double-digit Q1 production gains and says it is accelerating drilling faster than planned in the eastern half of the Permian Basin. Derivatives losses took a $42M bite out of profits, but are seen as immaterial to PXD's overall health. "Costs are under control, and these guys are executing on their plan," an RBC analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • WPZ

    Williams Partners (WPZ -2.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at BofA/Merrill, which views...

    Williams Partners (WPZ -2.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at BofA/Merrill, which views WPZ's risk/reward profile as balanced given its robust backlog of organic growth projects offset by weak natural gas liquids pricing, tight cash distribution coverage and H2 2013 equity needs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM

  • Nearly everyone's a winner today as it's not just stocks lit up bright green. Oil (USO +3.3%),...

    Nearly everyone's a winner today as it's not just stocks lit up bright green. Oil (USO +3.3%), gold (GLD +0.5%), silver (SLV +0.7%), and corn (CORN +1.8%), are all flying. Even bonds (TLT), which tumbled on the big dip in jobless claims, have returned back to flat. Notably lower is natural gas (UNG -6.3%), tumbling on an unexpected add to inventories and as spring finally seems to arrive in the States.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • CVLT

    An upgrade to Overweight from Piper helps CommVault (CVLT +6.1%) deliver big gains ahead of its...

    An upgrade to Overweight from Piper helps CommVault (CVLT +6.1%) deliver big gains ahead of its May 7 FQ4 report; the firm has raised its PT to $84 from $74, and thinks the latest release of its flagship Simpana backup/archiving software platform (Simpana 10) will drive additional share gains. CommVault, occasionally the subject of M&A speculation, currently trades at 49x estimated FY14 (ends March '14) EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • HL

    Shares of Aurizon Mines (AZK -9.2%) plunge after authorities in Quebec say a dam broke at its...

    Shares of Aurizon Mines (AZK -9.2%) plunge after authorities in Quebec say a dam broke at its Casa Berardi mine, spilling contaminated materials - ~150K cubic meters of liquid and 15K cubic meters of solids - into James Bay. Trading was halted and has resumed, but Nasdaq is investigating erroneous transactions.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • GILD

    The results of Gilead Sciences' (GILD +4.9%) Lonestar study are a significant positive data...

    The results of Gilead Sciences' (GILD +4.9%) Lonestar study are a significant positive data point for its hepatitis C program, says Leerink Swann's Howard Liang. He notes that the availability 8-week data, especially in more difficult to treat patients, could influence choice of agents. It's main competition at this point is AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV), which currently doesn't have an 8-week treatment arm, so the shortened duration could be a significant advantage. More details should be available on its earnings call later today at 4:30 EST: (Webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy (REGI +12.3%) posts double-digit gains a day after saying Q1 was the company's...

    Renewable Energy (REGI +12.3%) posts double-digit gains a day after saying Q1 was the company's strongest quarter ever in terms of biodiesel production (39.9M gallons) and gallons sold (38.9M). EBITDA adjusted for the reinstatement of the blenders tax credit was $22M, up 73% from Q1 2012, although if the 2012 portion of the tax credit is retroactively allocated, adjusted EBITDA was $23.2M during the comparable period last year. Revenues were broken down in a similar fashion for clarification. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR +7.2%) is posting a huge gain ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report, albeit on...

    Immersion (IMMR +7.2%) is posting a huge gain ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report, albeit on moderate volume - does someone know something, or is the haptic feedback tech provider just showing some of its trademark volatility? Shares are now up 62% YTD, aided in no small part by a March licensing deal with Samsung.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • EE

    El Paso Electric (EE +2.1%) gains after reporting Q1 per share earnings that easily beat Street...

    El Paso Electric (EE +2.1%) gains after reporting Q1 per share earnings that easily beat Street estimates today. Sales to retail customers increased 4.1% Y/Y, primarily due to the colder winter weather. Separately, Jefferies lifts its price target on the shares to $42.50 from $39 on the report, saying the stock is trading at a discount based on projected 2016 earnings of $2.85.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • DCTH

    Shares of Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +4.7%) are halted as the FDA's Oncologic Drugs Advisory...

    Shares of Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +4.7%) are halted as the FDA's Oncologic Drugs Advisory Committee meets to discuss its new drug application for marketing approval of its its Melblez Kit for Injection, which is used to treat patients with unresectable ocular melanoma metastatic to the liver. The stock had been hit hard last week after the FDA expressed concern over the treatment's high death rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVEO

    Shares of Aveo Pharmaceutical (AVEO -48%) resume trading after being halted earlier in the day...

    Shares of Aveo Pharmaceutical (AVEO -48%) resume trading after being halted earlier in the day following an FDA panel vote of 13 to 1 that its application for Tivozanib did not demonstrate a favorable benefit-to-risk evaluation for the treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE +2.8%) outperforms after UBS adds the online travel bookings provider to its...

    Expedia (EXPE +2.8%) outperforms after UBS adds the online travel bookings provider to its elaborately-named U.S. Alpha Most Preferred List. Shares tumbled last week due to a downbeat outlook for the company's Hotwire discount travel inventory site, and are still down 8% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • EBIX

    The SEC's probe of Ebix's (EBIX -5.6%) accounting has been "upgraded to a formal investigation,"...

    The SEC's probe of Ebix's (EBIX -5.6%) accounting has been "upgraded to a formal investigation," Bloomberg reports. That has led shares of the insurance software firm to tumble to $19.44, 2.8% below Goldman's $20/share buyout price. Bloomberg originally reported of an SEC probe back in Nov.; CEO Robin Raina responded by calling the report "inaccurate and misleading." SA contributor Gotham City Research has been quite critical of Ebix's accounting (also to Raina's displeasure).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • EMGC

    Midday top 10 gainers: IFT +46%. BBW +32%. STAA +26%. YELP +25%. RTK +19%. NETE +17%. ATTU +17%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: IFT +46%. BBW +32%. STAA +26%. YELP +25%. RTK +19%. NETE +17%. ATTU +17%. OMG +16%. MTSN +15%. TOWR +13%.
    Midday top 10 losers: NBL -72% (split). AVNW -15%. CIG -15%. SMA -15%. DXPE -14%. SAM -12%. LCUT -11%. AZK -10%. GTAT -10%. NEWP -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • ABMD

    Abiomed (ABMD +6.7%) moves up after Q1 revenues come in well ahead of expectations, lifted by a...

    Abiomed (ABMD +6.7%) moves up after Q1 revenues come in well ahead of expectations, lifted by a 22% jump in revenue from its Impella temporary heart product to $36.5M from $29.9M. An additional 30 hospitals purchased the Impella 2.5 during the quarter, bringing the total to 748 customer sites. An additional 55 hospitals purchased the Impella CP, bringing the total number of Impella CP sites to 106. Gross margin slipped to 79.8% from 81.8% Y/Y, while operating margin was 9.5%, compared to 7.9% over the same period.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • RAX

    Rackspace (RAX +3.1%) catches a bid on fresh speculation IBM is considering a bid for the company - a former IBM exec told GigaOm last month the IT giant has eyed both Rackspace and rival SoftLayer as M&A targets.
